info.name: sbs-api
info.description: Documented API endpoints for the Secure Banking System (SBS) developed by SyntaxSquad.

item.name: LOCAL /api/v1
/auth

request.description:
### Register

This endpoint allows users to register for a new account.

#### Request

The request should be sent via an HTTP POST method to [http://127.0.0.1:5000/api/v1/auth/register](http://127.0.0.1:5000/api/v1/auth/register) with the following parameters in the request body:

- username (text): The username of the user.
    
- email (text): The email address of the user.
    
- password (text): The password for the user's account.
    
- first_name (text): The first name of the user.
    
- middle_name (text): The middle name of the user.
    
- last_name (text): The last name of the user.
    
- date_of_birth (text): The date of birth of the user.
    
- gender (text): The gender of the user.
    
- ssn (text): The social security number of the user.
    
- address (text): The address of the user.
    
- phone_number (text): The phone number of the user.
    
- role (text): The role of the user.
    

#### Response

- Status: `201`
    
- Content-Type: `application/json`
    
- Data:
    

```
{
    "message": ""
}

 ```

#### Login

This endpoint is used to authenticate and login a user.

#### Request Body

- `username` (string, required): The username of the user.
    
- `password` (string, required): The password of the user.
    

#### Response

- Status: 200
    
- Content-Type: application/json
    
- `token` (string): A JWT for the authenticated user.

### Logout

This endpoint is used to log out an authenticated user.

#### Request

- Method: `POST`
- URL: `http://127.0.0.1:5000/api/v1/auth/logout`
- Header:
    - `Authorization` (string, required): JWT token of the authenticated user.

#### Response

- Status: `200`
- Content-Type: `application/json`
- Data:
    

```
{
    "message": "Logged out"
}

 ```

---

- Status: `400`
- Content-Type: `application/json`
- Data:
    

```
{
    "message": "Bad request"
}

 ```

---

- Status: `401`
- Content-Type: `application/json`
- Data:
    

```
{
    "name": "<error_name>",
    "message": "<error_msg>"
}

 ```

body.raw:
{
    "username": "merchant1",
    "email": "merchant1@business.org",
    "password": "verySecureMerchPass123!",
    "business_name": "Bloom Merch",
    "business_phone": "+18123456789",
    "business_doi": "2009-01-02",
    "ein": "538967342",
    "address": "1293 S. Walnut St, Bloomington, IN 47403",
    "owner_name": "Danielle Andre Lynch",
    "owner_dob": "1992-11-14",
    "owner_gender": "Female",
    "owner_ssn": "104329837",
    "owner_phone": "+18124967382",
    "role": "MERCHANT"
}

#### Login

#### Request Body

#### Response

- `token` (string): A JWT for the authenticated user.

### Logout

This endpoint is used to log out an authenticated user.

#### Request

- Method: `POST`
    
- URL: `http://127.0.0.1:5000/api/v1/auth/logout`
    
- Header:
    
    - `Authorization` (string, required): JWT token of the authenticated user.
        

#### Response

- Status: `200`

- Data:
    

```

 ```

---

- Data:
    

```

 ```

---

- Content-Type: `application/json`
    
- Data:
    

```
{
    "name": "<error_name>",
    "message": "<error_msg>"
}

 ```

### 2FA Enrollment

This endpoint is used to enroll a user for 2FA.

#### Request

- Method: `GET`
- URL: `http://127.0.0.1:5000/api/v1/auth/otp/enroll`
- Header:
    - `Authorization` (string, required): JWT token of the authenticated user.

#### Response

- Status: `200`
- Content-Type: `application/json`
- Data:
    

```
{
    "url": "otpauth://..."
}

 ```

### Verify OTP

This endpoint is used to verify the initial OTP to complete the 2FA enrollment.

#### Request

- Method: `POST`
- URL: `http://127.0.0.1:5000/api/v1/auth/otp/verify`
- Body:
    - `token` (string, required): The OTP entered by the user.

#### Response

- Status: `200`
- Content-Type: `application/json`
    
- Data:
    

```
true

 ```

### Validate OTP

This endpoint is used to validate the OTP entered by the user to perform sensitive operations.

#### Request

- Method: `POST`
- URL: `http://127.0.0.1:5000/api/v1/auth/otp/validate`
- Body:
    - `token` (string, required): The OTP entered by the user.

#### Response

- Status: `200`
- Content-Type: `application/json`
- Data:
    

```
true

 ```

item.description: This folder contains the Auth APIs.

item.name: /status

request.description:
### App Status

This endpoint retrieves the status information of all services.

#### Request

- Method: `GET`
    

#### Response

- Status: `200`
- Content-Type: `application/json`
- Data:
    

```
{
    "status": "UP",
    "message": "All services are up and running"
}

 ```

---

- Status: `500`
- Content-Type: `application-json`
- Data:
    

```
{
    "status": "UNSTABLE",
    "message": "One or more services are down",
    "services": {
        "auth": <status_code>,
        "transaction": <status_code>,
        "user": <status_code>
    }
}

 ```

### Auth API Status

This endpoint retrieves the status information of the Auth API.

#### Request

- Method: `GET`
    

#### Response

- Status: `200`
- Content-Type: `text/plain`
- Data:
    

```
OK

 ```

### Transaction API Status

This endpoint retrieves the status information of the Transaction API.

#### Request

- Method: `GET`
    

#### Response

- Status: `200`
    
- Content-Type: `text/plain`
    
- Data:
    

```
OK

 ```

### User API Status

This endpoint retrieves the status information of the User API.

#### Request

- Method: `GET`
    

#### Response

- Status: `200`
    
- Content-Type: `text/plain`
    
- Data:
    

```
OK

 ```

item.description: This folder contains the Status APIs.

item.name: /transaction

request.description: This request retrieves all transactions of the currently authenticated user.
This request retrieves all transactions of the currently authenticated user.

#### !!! WIP !!!

This request creates a new transaction.

#### !!! WIP !!!

This request creates a new transaction.

#### !!! WIP !!!

This request creates a new transaction.

This request retrieves a single transaction using the transaction ID.

#### !!! Documentation WIP !!!

This request allows a System Manager to update a transaction.

item.description: This folder contains the Transaction APIs.

item.name: /user

request.description: This request allows a System Manager/Admin to retrieve all accounts.
This request retrieves a single account using the Account ID.
This request retrieves a single profile using the User ID.
This request allows the currently authenticated user to raise an account closure request.
This request allows a System Admin to retrieve all user profiles.
This request retrieves a single profile using the User ID.
This request retrieves a single profile using the User ID.
This request allows the currently authenticated user to update their profile details.
This request allows the currently authenticated user to raise an profile deletion request.

item.description: This folder contains the User APIs.
This folder contains Version 1 of the SBS API.
